summary:
I am a social scientist (MA) and a development professional with over 20 years of working experience in international development cooperation: 13 years in Africa (Cameroon, Ethiopia) and 7 years in the Netherlands travelling to Asia. I started my career as an activist in women rights issues and contributed to the kick off of a very successful local organisation currently representing the voice of women victims of forced and early marriages. I am interested in a wide range of thematic areas and good at coordinating and managing the overview of complicated processes leading to the intended results. As a critical learner I have expertise in different approaches re. project cycle mgt, result based mgt, MEL, participatory & right based strategies, gender analysis. I gained experience on multi country programme and project management, multi donor grant management & contract compliance and developed monitoring tools for programme and financial management. As a leader I achieved successes in showing impact and change at programme/project level, winning contracts from various donors, organisational level reporting, policy development, staff recruitment and organisational change processes. My achievements are mostly results of well-coordinated team work, in which acceleration, problem solving and interpersonal skills are often my contributions.
Thematic areas: women and violence; gender empowerment; livelihoods; emergency; climate change & resilience; natural resource management; water, sanitation & hygiene; civil society & accountability. 

Personality: team player, committed, supportive, guiding, responsible, creative, good-humored & positive. Skills: Languages: Dutch & English excellent; French good; German understanding. Computer literate & driving license.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities & achievements: within this role I am responsible for managing institutional donor grants (average portfolio of £2M/year/10 contracts), contract compliance, donor trends of institutional donors (EU, DFID, Irish Aid, Comic Relief, etc), major gifts, trusts and foundations. I initiate and contribute to policy development and implementation re: finance monitoring tools, funding strategy in alignment with the country strategy paper, cost recovery & budget analysis, local partnership building. I also work on capacity development of programme staff and local partner organsiations to implement and manage institutionally funded projects successfully. In my presence the institutional funding base of CST broadened as well as we build efficient and effective skills and learning's on project design, reporting, finance and audits. 
Themes: Funding strategy, contract management & compliance, donor mapping & engagement, finance and audits, value for money, capacity building, humanitarian, livelihood development, civil society development, HIV & AIDS, Gender.
profile_positions.title: Institutional Funding Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities and achievements: Responsible for programme and grant management of the food facility programme funded by the European Union (€1.1M) implemented by 3 partner organisations. Within this role I have been successful in: complying with EU rules and regulations, working in consortia, guiding of 20 staff in project implementation and management (monitoring of progress &  finance), capacity building at organisational – and individual level. I led a consultancy for base line development and evaluation, undertook regular field visits for (financial) monitoring, evaluation, learning & reporting purposes incl. to local stakeholders. At country office, I contributed to strategic policy development; linking and networking; annual planning and reporting documentations. 
Themes: Food security (access, availability, markets), agriculture, natural resource management, micro finance, community participation and development, gender, physical construction works, capacity building.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator EU funded Food Security Project & Country level external relations Officer

profile_positions.description:

I contributed to innovative theme development on WASH and facilitated mutual sharing and learning by linking with centers of expertise & collaborating with governmental institutions. profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator BSF funded - Food Security Project

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities and achievements: I was responsible for the development of the Simavi country programmes in Bangladesh and Indonesia (€1M/yr). As a programme manager I linked the needs and interests of local partner agencies to Simavi’s aims by developing relevant country strategies. I coached local partner organisations on programme development, monitoring, evaluation and learning, budget analysis and organised external consultancies for monitoring, evaluation, organisational development, etc. I contributed to project design for institutional donors (Postcode Loterij, Dutch Government), trusts & foundations. Themes: Pro poor strategies, community based health care, WASH, reproductive health, HIV & Aids, capacity building, gender empowerment & human rights.
